data.title: Buy Microsoft (MSFT) Stock at Highs for More than Dividend and Buybacks
data.text: Microsoft (MSFT) stock appears to be one of safest mega-cap tech buys out there at the moment, even at its new all-time highs. And it just raised its dividend and announced a new share buyback program.

data.title: Buy Microsoft Stock at Its Highs for More Than the Dividend and Buybacks
data.text: Microsoft  stock appears to be one of the safest mega-cap tech buys out there at the moment, even at its new all-time highs. And MSFT just raised the dividend on MSFT stock.

data.title: Here's what Microsoft's big breakout means for the markets

data.title: Microsoft shakes up board, nominating GlaxoSmithKline CEO as two longtime directors depart
data.text: Microsoft announced big changes to its board of directors today.

data.title: Microsoft adds a fifth woman to its board: GlaxoSmithKline CEO Emma Walmsley
data.text: Four years ago Microsoft had just two women on its board. Walmsley is now the fifth.

data.title: Microsoft adds GlaxoSmithKline CEO to board, among other changes
data.text: Microsoft Corp. MSFT, +1.84% said late Thursday that it had nominated the Chief Executive of GlaxoSmithKline to the company's board of directors and that two long-serving board members are resigning.

data.title: MSFT Continues Buyback Frenzy
data.text: There is a time and place where stock buybacks are appropriate such as when the stock price is undervalued and there are no more productive uses for the money, but this can still be speculative.

data.title: Microsoft Is Returning Even More Cash to Shareholders
data.text: Microsoft unveils a dividend hike, buybacks, and new cloud-centered financial metrics to report.

data.title: Microsoft Stock Has Rallied 37% This Year. Now It Could Reach New Highs.
data.text: Shares of the software giant could go even higher.

data.title: Microsoft nudges S&P 500 toward record high
data.text: Microsoft and healthcare companies lifted Wall Street on Thursday, a day after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates as expected and left the door open for further monetary easing.

data.title: Microsoft hits all-time high after hiking dividend and buying back more stock
data.text: Microsoft is showering more money on its shareholders. They are loving it.

data.title: Microsoft, health shares boost Wall Street; S&P 500 eyes record high
data.text: Gains in Microsoft and healthcare shares boosted Wall Street's main indexes on Thursday, a day after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates as expected and left the door open for further monetary easing.

data.title: Microsoft Stock Notches New High On Dividend Hike, Share Buybacks
data.text: Microsoft, the world's most valuable company, added to its market cap on Thursday as investors responded to its increased dividend and share buybacks. Microsoft stock hit a record high.

data.title: Microsoft will stop telling investors how many people use Xbox Live as growth of game service slows
data.text: Microsoft has new services that can provide gaming revenue on top of console sales.

data.title: Daily Dividend Report: Microsoft, Great Southern Bancorp, Agilent Technologies, Target, W. P. Carey
data.text: Daily Dividend Report: Microsoft, Great Southern Bancorp, Agilent Technologies, Target, W. P. Carey

data.title: Why Microsoft is buying back $40B in stock
data.text: Microsoft is putting some of its piles of cash to work, authorizing a plan to re-purchase up to $40 billion in shares in one of the biggest stock buybacks in the company’s history.

data.title: Microsoft drives S&P 500 near record high
data.text: Gains in Microsoft shares pushed the benchmark S&P 500 within striking distance of its record high, a day after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates as expected but played down hopes of further monetary easing.

data.title: Microsoft stock hits new high after dividend hike, new buyback program
data.text: Microsoft Corp. shares MSFT, +2.51% are on track to close at a new record high on Thursday following the company's announcement of an 11% dividend increase and the approval of a new $40 billion stock buyback program.

data.title: Microsoft, energy stocks lift Wall Street at open
data.text: U.S. stocks opened higher on Thursday, boosted by Microsoft Corp and energy stocks, a day after the Federal Reserve cut rates as expected but played down hopes of further monetary easing.

data.title: Collect Income on Microsoft’s Bullish News
data.text:
Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) is working especially hard to become ubiquitous in the business world, and its recent successes make a good case for a bullish put write trade.
The post Collect Income on Microsoft’s Bullish News appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Microsoft's stock leads Dow gainers after dividend hike lifts yield above Apple's
data.text: Shares of Microsoft Corp. rose 1.3% to pace the premarket gainers among the Dow Jones Industrial Average's DJIA, +0.13% components.

data.title: Microsoft: $40 Billion To Nowhere
data.text: Microsoft announced an 11% dividend hike and a $40 billion share buyback.
